message: Hello Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $110.
Hello Alice, I appreciate your offer, but I was hoping to find the product for a bit less. Would you consider selling it to me for $95?
I understand you're looking for a good deal, but I have to make a living. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $105.
Thank you for your response, Alice. Considering your previous offer, I believe we could reach an agreement closer to $100. Would you be willing to sell the product for $100?
I'm not quite ready to sell at $100, but I'm willing to compromise. I can do $108, which is as low as I can go.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Alice. Given your last offer, I would like to propose $102 as my final offer. This price reflects both our interests in reaching a fair agreement.
I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I'm still not comfortable with $102. I can do $110, which is my absolute minimum, and I'm willing to walk away if you can't meet me there.
